abstracts.cdata!:
The Community Action Program Project
            Support Avian Flu for Niger consist changes of: (i) a
            six-month extension of the grant closing date from June 30,
            2010 to December 31, 2010, (ii) the reallocation of the
            Grants proceeds amongst the categories of expenditure; and
            (iii) the revision of the component's outcome
            indicators to make them measurable and in line with the
            region's core indicators. The initial seven months
            delay in project effectiveness and the political situation
            in 2009 and 2010, which resulted in a military coup on
            February 18, 2010 and the Bank automatically triggering the
            OP.7.30, slowed down progress in implementation of project
            activities. The changes will allow the Government to
            complete activities already initiated while including new
            activities which take into account the increasing threat of
            A/H1N1 and the needs for consolidating the country
            preparedness to effectively respond to major A/H5N1 and
            A/H1N1 crisis.
